quest.name: For the Good of the Guild
journal: Forgemaster H'naanza wishes to relay to you Blanstyr's next challenge.

Blanstyr has notified H'naanza of your contest's second-round challenge, a task that requires you to craft several pieces of armor within a strict, though somewhat ambiguous, time frame. Make haste and forge the necessary high-quality items: a pair of mythril-plated caligae, a reinforced mythril elmo, and a pair of mythril sollerets. When finished, deliver the finished pieces to the waiting forgemaster for appraisal.

Once again, H'naanza credits you for your fine work. Rather than declare you the victor, however, she has instead requested that you relinquish your armor to the guild to serve as a replacement order for the Maelstrom. Go to Blanstyr, and explain the delay in your submission.

Although your selfless deed has guaranteed victory for Blanstyr in the second round, you have made a vital contribution to the guild's continuing survival and prosperity. Return to honing your craft in preparation for the veteran artisan's final, and likely most demanding, challenge.

※The next armorer quest will be available from H'naanza upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Deliver a pair of mythril-plated caligae , a reinforced mythril elmo , and a pair of mythril sollerets to H'naanza.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Blanstyr has notified me of the challenge for the second round of your contest. Defeat in the first round has humbled him not a whit, it seems.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: You may have gained an early lead, Forename, but keep your focus sharp. As I have said before, complacency can be your downfall. And a man like Blanstyr is at his most dangerous when his pride is on the line.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Now, according to the wishes of our vindictive veteran, for this next round, you are to craft several items...and you must do so within a reasonable time frame to “reflect the pressures of an actual commission.” He fails to mention what he considers to be “reasonable,” so I suggest you work with dispatch.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: The challenge requires you to forge a pair of mythril-plated caligae, a reinforced mythril elmo, and a pair of mythril sollerets, all of the finest-possible quality.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Naturally, every one of these items requires an abundance of mythril ore... See how he deliberately chooses the same material as before? Such is Blanstyr's confidence in his ability, and his certitude that he cannot be beaten twice under similar conditions.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: This is your chance to unravel that obnoxious self-assurance, and end this contest with a second-round victory. If anyone can quench the fury of that insufferable aurochs, Forename, it is you.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Bring your submissions to me once you are satisfied with your forging. Take no shortcuts─I expect to see armor of unsurpassed quality.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Do you have the pieces required for the second round? I need to see a pair of mythril-plated caligae, a reinforced mythril elmo, and a pair of mythril sollerets─all of the best quality you can muster.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Well done, Forename─your work is flawless. I would declare you victor this very moment, except...

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: I need you to relinquish this armor to the guild. As for the why, it concerns a potentially dire loss of trust and reputation.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Do you recall the time you aided one of our novices with an order of bronze hoplons? Well, I'm afraid young Swithin has failed to deliver once more.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: He has improved much in his craft─spurred on as he was by your example─but again the lad accepted a commission he could never hope to honor. And one does not break a promise made to the Maelstrom...

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: I could drop full responsibility for this failure onto Swithin's unreliable shoulders, and cast him out of the guild. But what worth is a guild that does naught to support its own members when they truly need it?

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Blanstyr is a harsh man, but not entirely without reason. If you explain the circumstances, he may grant you a few extra days to forge your submission anew. What say you, Forename? Will you yield your work to the guild?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Yield your work to the guild?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: I understand how unreasonable this request must seem, but the livelihood of the entire guild is at stake. Without your armor to appease them, the quartermasters of the Maelstrom may never again entrust us with another commission.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Byregot's blessings upon you, Forename. Swithin! Come over here and show some gratitude!

dialogue.name: SWITHIN
dialogue.text: I don't know how to repay you for saving my neck yet again. I'll never forgive myself if it costs you your victory over Blanstyr...

dialogue.name: SWITHIN
dialogue.text: But the compassion you and the forgemaster have shown me this day will not be squandered, this I promise you. I'll work twice as hard! Three times, even!

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: We are in your debt. I'll arrange to have these pieces delivered to the Maelstrom quartermasters immediately.

dialogue.name: HNAANZA
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, you should hurry over to Blanstyr and explain the delay in your submission.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: What's this now? Ye let the guild have yer armor to make up a missed order!? Hahahaha, what'd I tell ye? Those fumble-fingered parasites're holdin' ye back at every turn.

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: Ye was meant to honor the terms of our contest, no matter the circumstances. Now, ye've neither the gear ye crafted to show for yer effort, nor the time to forge a new submission. This round goes to me!

dialogue.name: BLANSTYR
dialogue.text: I'd grant ye this ain't the kind o' victory a man looks for, but rules is rules, lasslad, an' failure comes with consequence. So, I don't want to hear no excuses for the final round. Ye just bring yer best work to the table, and we'll let the results stand for 'emselves.
